comments.comment: Whoever made these homes are definitely the people who make a house entirely out of gold and diamond blocks in Minecraft.
I love how whenever a house can't be expensive because of the place/view etc. they just make everything out of marble
Halfway through this recording I had to take a massive poo. The pain on my face wasn't just this terrible house.
Imagine being the person who invested 39 million  just to find this video of Pewdiepie and Ken roasting the living shit out of their new home

It's happening, Ken and Felix are officially transitioning into their middle aged dad form.They are even looking at homes together now lmao.


[Edit:] Omg he is actually gonna be a dad soon, Congrats Felix and Marzia!
Makes me think of a house I would've designed in the Sims, because all the stuff was the most expensive option thinking my Sims were living in luxury. Now I see what they really might be thinking.
no better combo than pewds and ken
You can really see that Ken is a dad when he commented on how dangerous those chairs are. That's a man that had to childproof his home
Doesn't even feel homey, just feels like a rock museum that you can also live in
i'll never get tired of Ken and Felix absolutely roasting the shi out of terrible expensive houses
Damn it, Pewds, you got me excited: I thought you were reviewing a legit MineCraft-style house someone built in real life.
Totally thought Pewds was back on Minecraft, but seeing another video with Ken wasn't a disappointment when it wasn't! The two of you are hilarious
I just want an entire series of Felix and ken looking at bad rental properties. I feel like it would be really fun for viewers to send in random house finds
I wish this became a series of expensive house reviews with ken and pewds
I'm glad after all these years Felix and Ken are still friends. It brings a smile to my face to see them still hanging out
I love how pewds described a firepit as a "360° fireplace" lmao
Watching Felix & Ken is like hanging out with uncles vibing & laughing at stuff, glad they are still friends +9 years later
I just want to say that I always notice clean and nice editing in pewds videos. Props to the editor, we notice you man.
As someone who nearly shattered their tailbone in an actual metal and stone museum, I can confidently say this is a prime location for broken bones and cracked skulls.

Steamrooms are a lot colder than saunas and the steam is automated and constant. The room is heated by the steam, while in sauna it is mainly heated by the "stove" and the rocks on it. Good on Pewds, they are totally not the same and Ken is lucky Pewds is from Sweden and not Finland. :D
This house is the exact reason why I think houses get worse after a certain point of expensive.
Clicked for Minecraft, stayed for Pewds and Ken
Living in that house will feel like living in a massive restaurant bathroom.
This house is the equivalent of making an entire Minecraft house out of diamond blocks

One tiny trip or fall in this place and you are absolutely going to hit one of those sharp ONYX corners. What a death trap. Also, love listening to them saying exactly what we're all thinking about this nonsense. Approved.
As an architect, this was funny as hell and I agree with everything said
Two minute silence for the architect who put his heart and soul designing this penthouse
I’d watch hours of Ken and Felix react to tacky expensive houses.

Pewds: I want 360 fireplace
Caveman 10,000 BC: *invents campfire”
That apartment alone will ruin the structural integrity of the building with all that extra weight.  I'd have nightmares about the building collapsing one night while I was sleeping.
0:20 thinking about slipping on the floor with that tub with the sharp edges, just standing there in the middle of the room, gives me so much anxiety......

The "Non-see through stuff" on scaffolding is a weather-barrier, it's designed for the workers on the scaffolding to be able to work even if it rains a bit or is hard winds, has nothing to do with aesthetics

In places where it doesn't rain a lot and  doesn't have hard winds they just need a barrier in case someone trips or drops something, which is a black/white see-through fabric that's draped over the entire thing

10:11 made me laugh
felix: "that looks terrible"
realtor: "true"
Putting carpets on the walls was how castles kept warm from all the exposed stone.
My heart tenders when I see that he is always so exited saying things about Japan and that he already got his dream about living there came true
cool thing about a house like that is that even if someone GAVE you this house you’d still have to pay about half a million dollars a year in property taxes for the rest of your life

A sauna uses dry heat, usually from hot rocks or a closed stove. Steam rooms are heated by steam from a generator filled with boiling water. While a sauna may help you relax and loosen your muscles, a steam room may have even further health benefits.

The more I see those snob rich ppls houses the more I like mine lol, everything is comfy and looks nice surrounded by woods and no ppl no noise, privacy and if I fall I won't crack my everything in hard stone or get cut in half by metal lol
Pie has all the money he could want. And his main pastime is hating on expensive properties. I love it.
As long as it has New York as a location, the price is gonna be outrageous

"If you're unfamiliar, the difference between a sauna and a steam room is in moisture level. In a sauna, you're getting dry heat. In a steam room, as the name implies, you're getting steamy, wet heat. Both have similar health benefits, though, so pick based on your preference."
That house is too trippy. Can you imagine being sleepy, stoned, drunk?  you can't find anything, everything look the same
10:11 "That looks terrible!" - "True"
I really love your Ken collaborations, I've been watching both of you for more than ten years, so it's always a joy to see you working together
When Ken and Pewds watch boring video's they somehow become interesting to watch haha
I like how Ken didn't originally pick up on Felix pointing out that it's weird to look at a park through binoculars and just kept going with what he was saying

Looking at this place I can just feel the frustration of anything that drops in this house immediately breaks... including people just walking. You know you gotta tank up your phone or it'll just be dead as soon as it slips off a surface.

15:40 Pewds : I gotta go Ken , i can't believe that you don't know the difference between a steam room and Sauna

*Few seconds later*

Felix :
Snow is falling outside, I'm all wrapped up in blankets all cosy, felix and Ken together for a video- life is good

A slick marble sharp-cut spiral staircase sounds like the absolutely worst idea  
Be careful and don’t wear low-friction socks! I’d hate to fall down those.
Как говорил один мудрец: Пью Ди Пай всегда научит говорить по английски)
videos with these two are my absolute favorite next to the Minecraft series

If I enter that house, I don’t know if I’ll get a migraine first or slip from the dang patterns and hit my head on the floor first. When she said “I would never leave this bathroom” it felt like an eerie foreshadowing of the next Manhattan ghost story…

Crazy first started watching pewds while he was making amnesia game throughs, and stopped watching him 2-3 years ago. Coming back made me realize how much we have changed as individuals, negatively and positively. And how we easily move on without noticing that’s why we have to appreciate everything in our lives.
My eyes honestly hurt just from watching that stone house video, I had to take a break to finish it, but it was worth it to hear Pewds and Ken collab again. Good work guys!
$39 million to be surrounded by taller buildings with countless windows that can look into your penthouse
I'm happy to see Felix move away from the original content and not force himself to make content in general and instead just make whatever he wants if he feels like it. I admire that.
Pewds pointing out her Scandinavian accent instantly. The reason he couldn't tell that she was Swedish right away was because she was putting on something really weird to hide it.

The look of horror on that person's face as they looked around that murder machine disguised as a house. I imagine they would look a lot like my profile picture, or maybe that meme of Italian Spiderman shaking his head in horror.

For 10 years I have been watch you. You have helped me through really tough times. I could be in the worst situation and I just pop one of your videos on and you always got me smiling. PewDiePie, Felix, I appreciate you. You are the best !

Hey Felix, this'll probably get lost in the shit ton of comments you get. You don't know me, but you have helped me through so much lately. You've gotten me to laugh and smile through times recently that I thought I couldn't.
